front.title: Expressing Quality of Service Requirements (QoS) in Domain Name System (DNS) Queries

abstract.t: A method of encoding quality of communication service (QoS) requirements in a Domain Name System (DNS) query is specified through inclusion of the requirements in one or more labels of the name being queried. This enables DNS responses including addressing and packet labeling information that is dependent on such requirements without changes in the format of DNS protocol messages or DNS application program interfaces (APIs).
